summary: This document is an index of discovery materials produced to the defense in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). It lists hundreds of items including FBI interview reports (302s), police reports, deposition transcripts, emails, notes, grand jury transcripts, and other evidence, spanning from 1995 to 2021.

keyFacts: The document is a comprehensive index of discovery (3500 material) produced to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team on October 25, 2021, containing hundreds of items.
The evidence spans nearly two decades, from a 1995 letter to materials from 2021, covering the initial Palm Beach police investigations (2003-2007) through to the federal prosecution.
The materials include sensitive investigative records such as FBI 302s, grand jury transcripts, police reports, deposition transcripts from civil cases, emails, and flight logs.

Several named individuals appear in the index, including potential witnesses (Robert Glassman, Glen McGorty), subjects of records (Joseph Nascimento), and correspondents (Brad Edwards, Sigrid McCawky).
The document is subject to a protective order restricting the disclosure of certain paragraphs, indicating the sensitive nature of the contents.
